DataElement.definition: The term that describes the kind of treatment administered.

DataElementConcept.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Executed and carried through to completion.
DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes:
1/31/24 Released per CRDC DSS for use in CDE 14713318. mr;
1/19/24 Created per CRDC DSS. mr

ObjectClass.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Medical care intended to treat or cure a condition or lessen its symptoms. This includes the administration of drugs, surgical procedures, physical or psychotherapy, or the use of therapeutic devices.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.definition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ValueDomain.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.definition: Cancer therapies designed to act upon specific molecules in metabolic pathways or processes involved in carcinogenesis, tumor growth, or tumor spread.

Concepts.definition: Cancer therapies designed to act upon specific molecules in metabolic pathways or processes involved in carcinogenesis, tumor growth, or tumor spread.

ValueMeaning.definition: Therapy designed to induce changes in a patient's immune status in order to treat disease.

Concepts.definition: Therapy designed to induce changes in a patient's immune status in order to treat disease.

ValueMeaning.definition: Various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level.

Concepts.definition: Various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level.

ValueMeaning.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

ValueMeaning.definition: A type of radiation therapy that uses a machine to aim high-energy rays at the cancer from outside of the body.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.

ValueMeaning.definition: A type of external radiation therapy that uses special equipment to position the patient and precisely give a single large dose of radiation to a tumor. It is used to treat brain tumors and other brain disorders that cannot be treated by regular surgery. It is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.

Concepts.definition: A non-surgical procedure that was developed to deliver one or several maximum dose targeted radiation treatments for cancers in the brain or spine.

ValueMeaning.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added OBIB alternate name and identifier DW 03-21-2019
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.1.20 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001943. ak

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ValueMeaning.definition: Stereotactic radiation therapy in which one or several maximum dose radiation treatments are delivered targeting cancers of the body, excluding the brain or spine.

Concepts.definition: Stereotactic radiation therapy in which one or several maximum dose radiation treatments are delivered targeting cancers of the body, excluding the brain or spine.

ValueMeaning.definition: A type of external beam radiation therapy using a beam of protons. It has the advantage of precisely localizing the radiation dose on the targeted tissue and avoiding damage to the healthy surrounding tissues.

Concepts.definition: A type of external beam radiation therapy using a beam of protons. It has the advantage of precisely localizing the radiation dose on the targeted tissue and avoiding damage to the healthy surrounding tissues.

ValueMeaning.definition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy

Concepts.definition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

ValueMeaning.definition: Internal radiation treatment that targets a cancerous tissue with low doses of radiation through the use of inserted temporary or permanent implants.

Concepts.definition: Internal radiation treatment that targets a cancerous tissue with low doses of radiation through the use of inserted temporary or permanent implants.

ValueMeaning.definition: Internal radiation treatment that targets a cancerous tissue with accurate, high doses of radiation through the use of inserted temporary implants.

Concepts.definition: Internal radiation treatment that targets a cancerous tissue with accurate, high doses of radiation through the use of inserted temporary implants.

ValueMeaning.definition: A process by which a dose of radiation is automatically shaped to closely conform to the entire volume of the tumor, so that surrounding normal tissue is spared and treatment toxicity is decreased.

Concepts.definition: A process by which a dose of radiation is automatically shaped to closely conform to the entire volume of the tumor, so that surrounding normal tissue is spared and treatment toxicity is decreased.

ValueMeaning.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.definition: A therapeutic procedure to eradicate or reduce small tumors using radiowaves to generate heat. The procedure is performed by the insertion of a thin needle through the skin and into a tumor, which is guided by computed tomography (CT) or ultrasound. Electrical energy delivered through this needle (electrode) heats and destroys the tumor. This therapeutic option is widely utilized by patients that have inoperable cancers, or are unsuitable chemotherapy candidates.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure to kill tissue using radiowaves to generate heat. The procedure is performed by the insertion of an electrode into a target tissue. Electrical energy delivered to the electrode heats and destroys the tissue.

ValueMeaning.definition: Treatment in which radiation therapy is administered at the same time as chemotherapy.

Concepts.definition: Treatment in which radiation therapy is administered at the same time as chemotherapy.

ValueMeaning.definition: Treatment of disease through the use of drugs.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of disease through the use of drugs.

ValueMeaning.definition: A clinical treatment in which HSC capable of reconstituting the immune system and blood production (hematopoiesis) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another. The donor and recipient may or may not be related. 2005

Concepts.definition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.

ValueMeaning.definition: The transference of stem cells within the same individual.

Concepts.definition: Stem cell transfer or transplantation in which the patient is their own donor.

ValueMeaning.definition: Not provided or available.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes:
3/4/25 Added alt VM names per RFC 26 CR 1. sl;
10/10/23 changed Long Name from "Not Stated" to match NCIt Preferred name and current caDSR concept Long Name of "Not Reported" per Brenda.Janice . LS

Concepts.definition: Not provided or available.

ValueMeaning.definition: A course of radiotherapy where minimal imaging support (i.e. X-rays films) is used to determine the positioning of radiotherapy.

Concepts.definition: A course of radiotherapy where minimal imaging support (i.e. X-rays films) is used to determine the positioning of radiotherapy.

ValueMeaning.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 3/26/24 Added alt VM name for ticket number CADSR0003572 cjl.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

ValueMeaning.definition: Treatment with an agent that contains a radioactive pharmaceutical agent.

Concepts.definition: Treatment with an agent that contains a radioactive pharmaceutical agent.

ValueMeaning.definition: Radiation therapy using photon beam.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy using photon beam.

ValueMeaning.definition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor.

Concepts.definition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.

ValueMeaning.definition: Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.

Concepts.definition: Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.

ValueMeaning.definition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.

ValueMeaning.definition: Radiation therapy using electron beam

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy using electron beam.

ValueMeaning.definition: The transfer of an organ, organ part, or tissue from one body to another, for the purpose of replacing the recipient's damaged or failing organ with a working one from the donor. Donors can be living, or cadaveric (dead).

Concepts.definition: The transfer of an organ, organ part, or tissue from one body to another, for the purpose of replacing the recipient's damaged or failing organ with a working one from the donor. Donors can be living, or cadaveric (dead).

ValueMeaning.definition: Palliative care is the patient-and family-centered active holistic care of patients with advanced, progressive disease. Traditional models reflect abandonment of proactive treatment and a simultaneous increase in symptom control and comfort-related services, as a disease progressed in linear fashion through its course. Essential components of palliative care are: pain and symptom control, communication regarding treatment and alternatives, prognosis, and available services, rehabilitation services, care that addresses treatment and palliative concerns, intellectual, emotional, social, and spiritual needs, terminal care, support in bereavement. The goal of palliative care is an achievement of the best quality of life for patients and their families.

Concepts.definition: The patient- and family-centered active holistic care of patients with advanced, progressive disease. Essential components of palliative care are: pain and symptom control, communication regarding treatment and alternatives, prognosis, and available services, rehabilitation services, care that addresses treatment and palliative concerns, intellectual, emotional, social, and spiritual needs, terminal care, support in bereavement. The goal of palliative care is an achievement of the best quality of life for patients and their families.

ConceptualDomain.definition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Medical care intended to treat or cure a condition or lessen its symptoms. This includes the administration of drugs, surgical procedures, physical or psychotherapy, or the use of therapeutic devices.
